title: Kerala’s AI prodigy Raul John Aju urges India to lead in AI
description: Raul John Aju, Kerala's youngest AI prodigy at 16, addressed the India Today South Conclave 2025, speaking on how artificial intelligence can be applied in education and business. He argued that India must build its own AI capabilities, invest in research, and equip the next generation with practical skills.
content:
At the India Today South Conclave 2025, Raul John Aju, Kerala's youngest AI prodigy at 16, spoke about artificial intelligence in clear, simple terms and urged Indians to build their own AI strengths.
He described AI as something people already use e... [2822 chars]

title: Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Every Aspect of Life - Bridging the Gap: China's Civilian Institutions in Defense AI
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly redefining the way we live, work, and interact. No longer confined to the realm of science fiction, AI is now a driving force behind innovations across all sectors— from healthcare and finance to entertainment and manufacturing. Its impact is far-reaching, transforming industries, reshaping economies, and influencing the way we navigate daily life.

title: Databricks projects $4 billion in annualized revenue on surging AI demand
description: Analytics firm Databricks said on Monday it was on track to hit $4 billion in annualized revenue, up more than 50% from the prior year, on the back of surging demand for its artificial intelligence products.
content:
Sept 8 (Reuters) - Analytics firm Databricks said on Monday it was on track to hit $4 billion in annualized revenue, up more than 50% from the prior year, on the back of surging demand for its artificial intelligence products.
This follows the data a... [830 chars]

title: US Authors Sue Apple For Alleged Use Of Their Books To Train AI Models
description: Tech giant Apple has been sued by two authors for alleged copyright violation over use of books to train AI models. Authors Grady Hendrix and Jennifer Roberson have filed a lawsuit in a federal court in Northern California, claiming that the company illegally used their copyrighted books to train its artificial intelligence models. The authors have requested the court to turn their complaint into a class action suit and block the company from further infringement of similar kind.

title: Study validates deep learning model for predicting future lung cancer risk in Black population
description: A new study presented at the International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer 2025 World Conference on Lung Cancer (WCLC) validates the use of Sybil, a deep learning artificial intelligence model, for predicting future lung cancer risk in a predominantly Black population.

title: Responsible AI in Finance: Moving From Conversation to Implementation
description: The global discussion around artificial intelligence has entered a new phase. What began as an arms race to launch the fastest and most powerful systems has now shifted toward a more sober question: how do we use these tools responsibly? In financial services, where accuracy and compliance are non-negotiable, the stakes are uniquely high. Why […]

title: The teenager taking on AI tech bros
description: President Trump wined and dined top AI tech executives last week, leaving little hope that Congress will regulate the emerging technology in meaningful ways. That leaves California — and a college activist — as the best hopes for putting guardrails on the coming artificial intelligence revolution.
content:
Sneha Revanur has been called the “Greta Thunberg of AI,” which depending on your politics, is an insult or, as the youngs would say, means she’s eating.
That’s good.
Either way, Revanur, a 20-year-old Stanford University senior who grew up in Silico... [8024 chars]

title: Data center builder Fermi files for US IPO as new listings accelerate
description: Fermi in June announced plans to build the world's largest energy and data complex, powered by nuclear along with natural gas and solar, to meet the rising energy demands of artificial intelligence.

title: AI workflow could help biofuel crops grow on infertile soil and protect plants from infectious diseases
description: Biologists and computational scientists at the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Brookhaven National Laboratory recently refined two artificial intelligence (AI) programs originally built by Meta, the company that owns Facebook, to predict protein shapes. Their new combined model, called ESMBind, can predict the 3D structure of proteins to reveal how they bind to nutrient metals like zinc and iron, which are essential for life.

title: iExec launches its privacy framework on Arbitrum
description: iExec, a decentralized physical infrastructure networks and artificial intelligence layer, has rolled out its privacy framework on Arbitrum.
